title: Level 6 Statistics and Probability Practice Test
description: Test your skills with mean, median, mode, interpreting data, and calculating probabilities.

questions.question: What is the mean of the data set $4, 7, 10, 3, 6$?
What is the median of $12, 5, 8, 15, 3, 9, 7$?
questions.explanation: First, order the data: $3, 5, 7, 8, 9, 12, 15$. There are $7$ values, so the median is the 4th value: $8$.

questions.question: A bag contains $3$ red, $5$ blue, and $2$ yellow marbles. What is the probability of randomly drawing a blue marble?
The mode of a data set is the value that:

options.text: Is in the middle when data is ordered
Is the sum divided by the count

questions.explanation: The mode is the value that occurs most frequently. The middle value is the median, and the sum divided by count is the mean.

questions.question: If the probability of an event occurring is $\frac{3}{10}$, what is the probability of it NOT occurring?
A newspaper reports that the average income in a suburb is $\$120{,}000$. A few millionaires live there. Which measure of centre would BEST represent a 'typical' income?
questions.explanation: The millionaires are outliers that pull the mean up. The median is not affected by outliers, so it better represents the typical income.

questions.question: A standard die is rolled. What is the probability of rolling a number greater than $4$? Give your answer as a fraction.
questions.explanation: Numbers greater than $4$: $5$ and $6$ — that's $2$ outcomes out of $6$. $P = \frac{2}{6} = \frac{1}{3}$.

questions.question: The data set is $3, 5, 5, 7, 8, 8, 8, 9, 10$. What is the mode?
questions.explanation: $8$ appears $3$ times, which is more than any other value. So the mode is $8$.

questions.question: Tom flipped a coin $80$ times and got heads $36$ times. What is the experimental probability of heads as a percentage?
